title: How chemists could give new life to old wind turbine blades - MIT Technology Review
summary: Researchers at Aarhus University in Denmark have developed a method to recycle the epoxy resin used in wind turbine blades, breaking down the plastic without damaging the glass fibers. This method involves using solvents and a catalyst to break down the epoxy, allowing for the recovery of both the resin and the fibers, which can then be reused in new products. This innovation aims to address the issue of waste generated by decommissioned wind turbine blades, which are currently difficult to recycle due to the strength of the epoxy resin.
